title: Electric PE - W and Delta U to move point charge 3

content.question:
Two point charges are fixed in place at adjacent corners of a square, as shown in the figure labeled “Initial Positions.” Point Charge <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has a charge <math alttext="negative q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mi>q</mi></math> and Point Charge <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has a charge <math alttext="positive q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math>. A third point charge, Point Charge <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, also has a charge <math alttext="positive q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math> and is initially far away from point charges <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. An external force then moves Point Charge <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> along the straight-line path indicated by the arrowheads in the figure labeled “Final Positions.” Which of the following correctly describes whether the change <math alttext="delta U sub 1 2 3, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>123</mn></msub></math> in electric potential energy of the three-point charge system and the work <math alttext="W sub 1 and 2 on 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mrow><mtext>1&2</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>on</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>3</mtext></mrow></msub></math> done by point charges <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> on Point Charge <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> are positive or negative as Point Charge <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> is being moved into place?
<math alttext="delta U sub 1 2 3, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>123</mn></msub></math><math alttext="W sub 1 and 2 on 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mrow><mtext>1&2</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>on</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>3</mtext></mrow></msub></math>APositivePositiveBPositiveNegativeCNegativePositiveDNegativeNegative

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
